channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report E-2023110215
item.description:
Report E-2023110215

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: SAN LORENZO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 31, 2023, seven (7) one-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately six (6) ounces of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the UN1263 impacted impacted dock floor. AS personnel solidified and neutralized the damaged pails of product. The damaged pails and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023110112
item.description:
Report X-2023110112

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: FAIRFIELD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver had placed a code 10: Inspection Required. I went to collect it, item was left in front of the van after returning from delivering packages. Unsure the exact sequence of events that led to the incident. DescribePack: Small piercing at the bottom of the container, possibly half a centimeter in width. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: Item was bagged multiple times to minimize the leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023101416
item.description:
Report X-2023101416

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG CAME FROM UNLOAD WET. TWO OF THE CONTENTS ARE CRACKED UNDER THEIR HANDLES. ALL CONTENTS ARE SOILED. SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG. DescribePack: TWO OF THE CONTENTS ARE CRACKED UNDER THEIR HANDLES. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG.

item.title: Report X-2023101412
item.description:
Report X-2023101412

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found leaking while being sorted for delivery during Inbound. The package was found leaking, and QA was called. QA promptly used a Hazmat tote to pick up the package and absorbent pads to clean up the leaking. The package was brought to the Hazmats to be inspected and processed. DescribePack: The package contents were spilling from the cap and were dented during sort. there was no bracing or filament in the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA brought absorbent and a tote to clean up what ever leakage was at location. Everything was handled with gloves and brought to hazmats to be processed and inspected.

item.title: Report X-2023101371
item.description:
Report X-2023101371

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: VENTURA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: pkg was being loaded onto van line conveyor by package handler when bottom of box ruptured and contents fell out of bottom and onto dock. items broke upon impact. Managers on scene sectioned off the area, used absorbent pads for spill, and removed nearby personnel from area. I was called to the scene for immediate clean up. DescribePack: package failed at bottom of carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: use of absorbent pads for spill, use of fan for ventilation, use of cones for sectioning off area

item.title: Report X-2023101370
item.description:
Report X-2023101370

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was been unloaded when the package handlers noticed that the box was leaking, and a QA was called for inspection which brought it for a thorough inspection to a certified admin. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was found that a bottle had a loose cap, causing the spillage, there was no inner packaging besides a slim tape on top of the caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was promptly brought for attention to an admin to get the proper PPE and mitigate any possible damage.

MARKED AS FULLY REGULATED DESPITE 019 SHIPMENT CODE AND LACK OF OP-900. DescribePack: TWO BOTTLES LEAKED A MINOR AMOUNT FROM CAPS JUST FINGER TIGHT. SPILL ISOLATED TO PACKAGING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023101272
item.description:
Report X-2023101272

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-12
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler Noticed package was leaking black liquid and informed management. Manager cleared the area and used absorbent to stop leak from spreading, and then called QA HAZ Admin to come and collect the damaged Hazmat. DescribePack: The top cap of 1/4 paint cans came loose due to the paint can getting dented. The other 3 cans seem to have dents as well, but caps remained secured. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent was used to stop spread of leak. QA HAz Admin also placed the leaky hazmat package into a hazmat bag with absorbent and clean-up absorbent, and then placed the bag into a hazmat tote.

  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: We received a call over the radio of a hazmat spill. When i arrived a the site of the spill I covered the spill with absorbent and placed the package in a tote lined with absorbent pads. I then placed the package under the vent to let it dry. DescribePack: There is a white fiberboard box with with a brown fiberboard box on the inside that contained the bottles of alcohol. There was nothing wrong with the packaging; the only problem was that the cap to one of the bottles had come loose, which caused the spill. After tightening the cap nothing more was leaking out. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent material was placed around the spill to contain the leak, and the package was placed in a tote with absorbent pads.

Package was placed in a clear hazardous waste bag and into a red hazardous bin which was layered with absorbent.

Report X-2023101014

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: PALMDALE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found outside on the rollers, and the box looked damp as if it was leaking or leaked on. Further inspection of the contents found one of the containers was lighter than the rest, suggesting a leakage of contents. It was then brought to the QA cage for processing. DescribePack: There is a large dent in the side of the container that was found to be lighter than the rest. The dent was located against the side of the box, which suggests it may have been dropped or pressed against something to cause a leakage out of the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Separated from the other packages and brought to the QA cage. Most of the liquid was soaked up by the box.

Two of the bottle have a deep dent on the body and residue of the contents are seen from the lip of the mouth down to the body of the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediately placed in a plastic lined container and wiped down any spills in the trailer.

QA responded to call and removed the hazmat properly. Found on the floor in the load side leaking internally. DescribePack: The bottles had loose caps which caused the internal leakage.   • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release at the OAKH facility. The fiberboard box contained four 1 gallon plastic containers separated with fiberboard dividers. The caps on two pf the plastic containers had come off causing a spill inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment exterior box was wet on the top and sides , and taken out of the sort stream. Excess liquid was soaked up with absorbent materials and the rest of the shipment was put into a plastic lined container DescribePack: The cap on the bottle was finger loose. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up with absorbent materials, and the rest of the shipment was placed into a plastic lined container.

item.title: Report X-2023100696
item.description:
Report X-2023100696

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the Inbound sort the package was damaged while loading into a can. QA was called to pick up the mess and clean up any spill corresponding to the contents. All clean up materials and package contents were brought to the hazmat cage to be inspected and processed. DescribePack: While the package was being loaded the lid on the cans of paint came loose letting the paint inside get onto the floor. The lid came loose due to an over look on package handling. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was quickly placed upright and the spillage was quickly cleaned, than relocated to bin in the hazmat area to be processed
